intro: Gnaphalium thuarsii, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant produces fluffy, white to pale yellow blooms that are often used in floral arrangements due to their delicate appearance. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Gnaphalium thuarsii is also noted for its aromatic leaves, which emit a subtle, pleasant scent.
